intro: Marsypianthes arenosa, commonly known as the sand dune daisy, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit, which helps it survive in harsh, sandy environments. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming during the winter months. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to store water and reduce transpiration. Marsypianthes arenosa plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sand dunes and providing habitat for local wildlife.
